page.title: 12CARDINHAM WOODS,CARDINHAM
page.content:
The bulk of the woods are made up of various varieties of coniferous trees as these are commercially viable. There are Douglas Firs which are the best, at the lower levels and Sitka Spruce and Larches higher up.The Forestry Commission tries to break up large areas of the same trees both for forestry hygiene and to improve the attractiveness of the area.
Approximately a quarter of a million trees are planted here every year and are felled on average when they are 25 metres tall and 45 years old.The thinnings go for pulp,chipboard and firewood,the better wood for fencing and the best wood for building works.
